section.title: Modeling the Animal Premises
section.para: Computers can be thought of as mechanisms or containers for modeling an aspect of the real world. The Tracker software application models the animals and events associated with or contained within the premises of a farm or a livestock infrastructure provider. The Tracker application uses a document paradigm to model an animal premises.

section.title: Tracker Model Documents
section.para: Whether it is word processing, spreadsheets, or presentation, today's computer users are most familiar with applications that utilize a document paradigm that create documents that represent (model) information.

The Tracker enables users to create, transform and edit tracker model documents that represent (model) specific Animal Premises. Model documents are displayed and manipulated with the various Tracker Editors, Wizards, and Importing and Exporting utilities. The attributes of the premises, the animals in the premises and the events associated with animals are specified within these model documents. Model document files utilize a .tracker file extension to distinguish them from other file.

section.title: Tracker Data Model
section.para: All tracker model documents conform to the Tracker Data Model. In the Tracker Data Model a single Premises contains 0 or more animals. Each Animal must have at least one but may have more than one (identification) tags. Each Tag must have at least one but may have more than one associated events.
